page.title: 17EDUCATING EPPING
page.content: Teachers have been{in dispute}for so long recently that some things that usually happen ,haven't. The problems of today with the pupils at{St.Johns {Comprehensive School}are family life and insecurity. The Headmaster's feelings are that these aspects are the cause of trouble at home and school. The number of pupils attending was{1,300}but now it's{1,076.}Out of 35 forms in the school there is a 100 strong sixth form. Those leaving at 16 go to further training or get a job. 12 leavers may be{unemployed.}Small businesses around Epping employ many young people.The girls like going up to London for a job as a typist or a secretary in spite of the high fares. St.John's has an eye to the future. {Economics}and{computing}are subjects of the eighties.
